body:

Si vede che sono rimasta entusiasta di aver provato la LatteGo 5500 ultimo modello della Philips?
Eppure, vi dir√≤, qualche difettuccio ce l'ha e nei suoi 600 e passa euro mi sarei aspettata di non trovarli.

Cosa arriva?
Oltre alla macchina automatica LatteGo Philips, arrivano una serie di piccoli accessori per la manutenzione e per il dosaggio del caff√®. Manuale compreso, ma onestamente quasi del tutto inutile visto che per avere le istruzioni complete devi scaricarlo da internet e sorbirti le settordici versioni nelle altre lingue prima di trovare la tua!

Cosa fare per prima cosa?

Dopodich√® comincia l'avventura, ovvero trovare le impostazioni giuste per ottenere un caff√® decente senza prima sprecarne etti ed etti invano.

La LatteGo funziona sia con caff√® macinato (ma onestamente non l'ho provato) che in grani. Dotato di macinacaff√® in ceramica incorporato, non teme il confronto e regala un aroma decisamente diverso rispetto a quello gi√† confezionato. Basta caricare il contenitore del caff√® posto sulla parte superiore ed attivare la macchina.

Il pannello di controllo √® molto intuitivo e selezionare/impostare la bevanda preferita √® semplice.
Partiamo dal caff√® espresso.
Ve lo dico subito: i primi tentativi saranno un disastro. Caff√® annacquato come se non ci fosse un domani e tazzine che volano perch√® non riesci a capire come farne uno decente. In realt√† √® una cosa normale: la macchina si assesta dopo almeno un centinaio di caff√®, come riporta il manuale, ma io sono riuscita ad ottenere un ottimo caff√® espresso all'italiana gi√† dopo meno di 20 tentativi. In che modo?

Il segreto per un buon caff√® con la LatteGo 5500 Philips √® il macinacaff√®.
Le impostazioni di fabbrica partono da un livello 9-12 che √® piuttosto grossolano e fa un caff√® decisamente annacquato, un po' come lo amano all'estero. Il consiglio √® di impostare subito il macinacaff√® ad un livello tra 2 e 4, che √® pi√π fine e permette di avere un infuso pi√π aromatico e cremoso.

Una volta che avrete impostato il macinacaff√® per mezzo della manopola posta nel contenitore apposito, passate alla selezione delle preferenze per il caff√® espresso. Mantenetevi su un livello medio-alto (non al massimo), a meno che lo vogliate lungo (in questo caso aumentate la dose fino ad arrivare a One Shot, che √® una piccola quantit√† aggiuntiva). Selezionate la quantit√† di caff√® e quante tazzine, infine avviate la macchina.
Se amate il caff√® come al bar, mantenete queste impostazioni e, per avere 2 tazzine degne di questo nome, selezionate 1x anzich√® 2x, cos√¨ avrete un caff√® pi√π ristretto e cremoso.
E' possibile anche impostare la temperatura dell'acqua, se preferite un caff√® bollente o meno.

Non ho ancora provato tutte le bevande disponibili, ma solo quelle pi√π classiche come cappuccino, latte macchiato e caff√® ristretto. Il montalatte crea una buona schiuma, magari non proprio come quella del bar, ma anche qui bisogna un po' giocare con le impostazioni standard e personalizzarle secondo il proprio gusto.

Quali sono i suoi pregi?
Beh, come gi√† detto, una volta trovate le impostazioni che pi√π ci aggradano, avrete un caff√® aromatico e cremoso come quello del bar in meno di 2 minuti e in maniera automatica.
Non dovrete neanche premurarvi di pulire perch√® √® dotata di un sistema di auto clean ogni volta che la spegnete.
E' abbastanza silenziosa, considerando che sia il macinacaff√® che la pompa dell'acqua solitamente sono piuttosto rumorose ovunque. Un dettaglio trascurabile anche perch√®, vista la rapidit√† di azione della macchina, non disturba nemmeno.
Accontenta tutte le esigenze ed √® versatile su molti fronti. Puoi usare latte normale o latte vegetale, non ci sono limiti ai tipi di caff√® che puoi usare, n√® alle bevande che puoi ottenere, sia calde che ghiacciate (il ghiaccio per√≤ lo metti tu!).
Ognuno pu√≤ memorizzare le proprie impostazioni su un profilo personale ( fino a un massimo di 4).
Inoltre il vassoio √® estraibile e puoi svuotare sia i fondi di caff√® che l'acqua in maniera facile e veloce.

Quali sono i suoi difetti?
La uso da meno di un mese, √® vero, ma ci√≤ che salta all'occhio √® quanto sia plasticosa questa LatteGo! Me l'aspettavo un pochino pi√π robusta. body:
Siamo di fronte ad una macchina per il caff√® totalmente automatica, prodotta dal noto marchio Philips e che, come tale non delude affatto le aspettative.

All‚Äôinterno della confezione troviamo, oltre al corpo macchina, il cavo di alimentazione (Schuko <> IEC C13), un filtro Aquaclean (anticalcare), una striscia test per misurare la durezza dell‚Äôacqua, la griglia/coperchio del vassoio portatazze, un dosatore per il caff√® gi√† macinato, un tubetto di lubrificante per il gruppo infusore, il coperchio del vano caff√® e manualistica varia.

La prima cosa da fare √® verificare il grado di durezza dell‚Äôacqua di casa ovvero quella che utilizzeremo per preparare le bevande. Successivamente andremo ad inizializzare il filtro ‚ÄúAquaclean‚Äù; lo agitiamo per qualche secondo e lo immergiamo nell‚Äôacqua. Il manuale raccomanda di immergerlo per 30 secondi ma in realt√† ci vuole un pochino pi√π di tempo in modo che si riempia per bene. Sar√† opportuno dargli una mano dandogli qualche colpetto in acqua in modo che cominci a fare le bollicine.

Ora possiamo accendere la macchina; dopo aver selezionato la lingua ci verr√† chiesto se attivare il filtro Aquaclean e la relativa durezza che avevamo precedentemente misurato (i 4 quadrati rossi). Terminato questo step la macchina effettuer√† un risciacquo e sar√† pronta per il primo caff√®. Ovviamente √® opportuno predisporre anche la brocchetta del latte (LatteGo) assemblando i tre pezzi di cui √® composta.

Come avrete visto dalle caratteristiche, la macchina pu√≤ essere caricata sia con caff√® in grani che con caff√® gi√† macinato. Ovviamente i migliori risultati si avranno con quello in grani poich√© potremo intervenire anche sul grado di macinatura agendo su una manopola che consente ben 12 gradazioni diverse. Pi√π il valore sar√† basso pi√π il caff√® verr√† macinato finemente (con conseguente aumento dell‚Äôintensit√† del gusto) Il manuale raccomanda di modificare l‚Äôimpostazione dopo almeno un centinaio di caff√® (per far ‚Äúassestare‚Äù il tutto); considerate che le variazioni non sono immediate ma ve ne accorgerete dopo qualche somministrazione.

Detto questo ora possiamo sbizzarrirci con tutte le bevande a base di caff√®.
La macchina √® tarata con ricette di base non troppo intense ma sappiate che si possono variare tutti i parametri per ottenere la nostra ‚Äúquadra‚Äù; quindi potremo aumentare/diminuire la quantit√† di polvere di caff√® utilizzata, la quantit√† di bevanda somministrata, la quantit√† di latte (questo per ogni pulsante o bevanda presente); nelle impostazioni generali √® possibile anche variare la temperatura. Il display a colori √® estremamente esauriente nelle informazioni che fornisce. Chiaramente il risultato dipender√† anche dalla tipologia e qualit√† di caff√® che avremo utilizzato.

Per quanto mi riguarda ho ottenuto un buon espresso selezionando il pulsante ‚ÄúMore drinks‚Äù (altre bevande), scegliendo ‚Äúristretto‚Äù ed impostando la quantit√† di caff√® alla penultima tacca, riducendo al minimo la quantit√† di liquido (√® possibile anche preparare due caff√® contemporaneamente). C‚Äô√® anche una ulteriore tacca chiamata ‚ÄúExtra shot‚Äù che consente di utilizzare una dose maggiorata di caff√® per ottenere un risultato ancora pi√π ‚Äústrong‚Äù.
Per quanto riguarda le bevande con il latte, devo dire che quest‚Äôultimo viene montato perfettamente ottenendo una schiuma con una ottima consistenza e dimostrando che il sistema ‚ÄúLatteGo‚Äù funziona molto bene. E‚Äô anche possibile preparare bevande fredde, utilizzando il ghiaccio come da indicazioni nel manuale.

La macchina √® dotata di due profili di impiego pi√π uno ‚Äúospite‚Äù; nei profili verranno memorizzate le variazioni che faremo per ogni bevanda/pulsante che utilizzeremo in modo da ritrovarle successivamente (nel profilo ‚Äúospite‚Äù non vengono memorizzate) e non dover rifarle ogni volta.

E‚Äô chiaro che per mantenere inalterata nel tempo l‚Äôefficienza della macchina occorrer√† fare della manutenzione periodica ed utilizzare costantemente il filtro Aquaclean (sostituendolo quando la macchina ce lo segnala sul display); ad ogni modo la manutenzione non √® assolutamente impegnativa come vedrete dalle indicazioni sul manuale.

In conclusione una macchina che funziona molto bene, silenziosa e che potr√† darci ottimi caff√® (e derivati).

title: Never look back
body:
After about a month of regular use, these are my thoughts:

Things I liked:

+ First things first. It's a superb coffee machine. It automates every step of the process from bean to cup and makes outstanding, delicious coffee. I have only ever owned sub-¬£100 coffee pod machines and regular basic filter coffee makers, so this is a considerable step up (and this also gives you a frame of reference for my own experience that I'm using to judge this machine - I'm not a professional coffee machine reviewer but I do enjoy my coffee!)
+ In my opinion, you simply have to spend a bit of time learning about the machine and getting it set up right to make the most of it. You will get the benefits down the line, but if you put in the effort at the start, you'll reap the benefits later on. Everything is customisable, from the initial water hardness during setup, to the strength, volume and even temperature of your final cup (with sliders to get it just right).
+ My morning cup is different from my wife's. But it's really easy just to save your preference to your own profile. So if my cup is stronger but shorter and hers is a bit longer but less intense, that's fine. It's really easy to switch between them.
+ It's worth noting that there are other features that you might not have thought of. For example, it's able to dispense (near)instant hot water.
+ I think the machine is at its best when going from bean to cup, but you can add pre-ground coffee instead if you prefer. There's so much you can adjust to get your coffee just the way you want it, but if you just want a simple latte or cappuccino, it doesn't have to be that complicated either!

Things I didn't like:

- The price - ¬£650 makes this a significant investment. While I feel like you get great quality from it (in terms of the build quality and design choices), it's more than I would have ever spent on a coffee machine.
- It's not silent. It's got a bean grinder and it makes the noise of a bean grinder. Unless you're expecting it to be able to simply persuade the beans to crumble (and at this price, you might be), you have to accept that it will make noise when grinding beans. It's fine - it doesn't bother me in the slightest.

Do I recommend it?

Yes. I'm not going to dwell on how much it costs - if you're planning to buy this, you're already aware of the price. What I will finish by saying is that it makes fabulous coffee, really easily, straight from the bean. It can be as simple or as complicated as you want it to be and, unfortunately for me, it has spoilt me and I'm never going back. It's just great.

body:
Ho aspettato un po‚Äô prima di recensirla perch√© una macchina da caff√® va sempre rodata un po': si deve trovare la quadra con le impostazioni e questa di impostazioni ne ha molte.
Premetto subito che parte dei suggerimenti sono fatti per un target internazionale, ma quando si parla di caff√® noi italiani abbiamo idee abbastanza integraliste.
Quindi se si vuole un caff√® che si avvicini un po' al nostro gusto, si deve fin da subito impostare la macinatura il pi√π fine possibile ruotando il selettore in senso antiorario fino a che si raggiunge l‚Äôimpostazione di macinatura 1. Philips suggerisce di provare prima l‚Äôimpostazione di fabbrica che √® a met√† e scendere piano piano: lasciate perdere!
Altra impostazione da settare √® la temperatura: subito al massimo. Infine attenzione al risciacquo finale che, se da una parte scalda il circuito, dall‚Äôaltra se non si sta attenti rilascia un po' di acqua nella tazza prima di erogare il caff√®.
Fatta questa premessa per riuscire a ottenere un caff√® il pi√π vino possibile a un espresso si deve entrare nel men√π ‚Äúaltre bevande‚Äù, selezionare il caff√® ristretto e impostare il primo parametro (che dovrebbe corrispondere all‚Äôintensit√†) al penultimo step, perch√© lo step successivo √® l‚Äôextra shot. In pratica quest‚Äôultima opzione corrisponde a un doppio caff√® con relativa doppia macinatura, ma attenzione corrisponde anche a doppia lunghezza. Quindi fate le vostre considerazioni in base anche al secondo parametro da settare: la lunghezza.

A questo punto la domanda sorge spontanea: riesce a fare un caff√® forte e intenso come al bar?
La risposta √®: NO.
E‚Äô un buon caff√®, ma non arriva a quel livello e ci sono macchine dedicate che ci si avvicinano di pi√π. Molto dipende dalla qualit√† del caff√® che avete scelto. Io, per esempio, ho preso un 100% arabica e probabilmente con una qualit√† robusta avrei ottenuto un caff√® pi√π forte. Se siete abituati al Nespresso (non Vertuo) sicuramente lo troverete pi√π forte.

Per quanto riguarda altre bevande come cappuccino, latte macchiato, latte montato, caffellatte, caff√® freddo e tutte le altre fredde o calde, la macchina d√† il suo meglio soprattutto per la semplicit√†. Da quando √® arrivata i ragazzi, si preparano da soli la colazione e sono ben felici di aver sostituito il ‚Äúbanale‚Äù latte caldo con il latte montato.
Anche il lavaggio del montalatte √® decisamente pratico e viene fatto direttamente dalla macchina attivandolo dal men√π clean.
Nonostante il top per appoggiare le tazzine sembri quello delle macchine da bar che serve a tenerle calde, √® solo un ripiano non riscaldato

In conclusione il mio giudizio √® positivo. E‚Äô un bellissimo elettrodomestico che ha senso comprare se si sfrutta per fare pi√π bevande. Perfetta per la famiglia ma anche per un piccolo ufficio. Non la prenderei per il solo caff√®. Da tenere in considerazione anche l‚Äôingombro non indifferente.

body:
This is my first ever coffee machine, having previously lived my coffee life quite happily from a kettle. I never knew I'd want a machine like this, but it has genuinely changed how much I enjoy coffee during the day.

Non sto a descrivere tutte le tipologie di caff√® che √® capace di preparare (sia calde che fredde - non √® fornita per√≤ di refrigeratore), cercher√≤ di spiegare la mia esperienza d'uso e quello che mi colpito di questo prodotto, che al momento della recensione, viene offerta al pubblico a circa 700 euro. Giusto per dare un esempio, solo per il caff√® esiste l'opzione espresso, ristretto, ristretto lungo, caff√® e americano (senza contare anche l'opzione caff√® da asporto).

Una volta accesa, la macchina raggiunge la temperatura in pochissimo tempo. Per ogni bevanda si pu√≤ scegliere, l'intensit√† (ovvero la quantit√† di caff√® che la macchina deve macinare al momento), la quantit√† di acqua (in pratica la lunghezza del caff√®) e la quantit√† di latte/schiuma desiderata. Mi sono accorto che la macchina √® molto precisa nelle quantit√† scelte: se vogliamo un caff√® da 30ml, in tazza la macchina verser√† esattamente 30ml di caff√®.
Oltre a queste impostazioni, possiamo inoltre decidere il grado di macinatura (12 livelli differenti, fine per caff√® forti, grossa per caff√® pi√π leggeri) e la temperatura dell'acqua (3 livelli pi√π l'opzione risciacquo iniziale per aumentare ancora di pi√π la temperatura del caff√®).
Come si capisce i settaggi e le opzioni possibili che la macchina offre sono decisamente tante e spaziano dall'americano, al latte macchiato, alla sola acqua calda al caff√® ristretto. All'inizio i caff√® erano decisamente scialbi e leggeri, ma dopo prove e tempo ho raggiunto un livello che si avvicina al caff√® del bar (si parla di circa 100 caff√® come del resto le istruzioni suggeriscono). Personalmente ho scelto il massimo dei settaggi possibili: ho impostato la maggior macinatura fine possibile, livello alto di temperatura, risciacquo iniziale e livello di intensit√† alto per l'erogazione del caff√®: in questo modo il caff√® √® un vero espresso.

Altro punto che mi ha piacevolmente sorpreso √® la facilit√† di pulizia che possiede: Philips deve aver investito molto su questo aspetto. All'interno del serbatoio √® presente un filtro e al momento della prima accensione dobbiamo impostare anche il livello di durezza dell'acqua. Inoltre il contenitore del latte ha un'opzione dedicata per il lavaggio: la macchina invia acqua calda in modo da pulirne le pareti e l'ugello. Infine, tutte le volte che spengiamo la macchina, questa espelle una piccola quantit√† di acqua calda per pulire gli ugelli del dispenser, tra l'altro regolabile in altezza per adeguarlo al contenitore (tazzina o bicchiere).
La manutenzione √® davvero poca: a parte i lavaggi classici che sono direi obbligatori se vogliamo un caff√® degno del nome, una volta a settimana occorre pulire anche il gruppo infusore, il vero cuore della macchina. Quello che non mi ha convinto invece √® la qualit√† della schiuma del latte prodotta, mi aspettavo di meglio. I cappuccinatori economici riescono a creare molta pi√π schiuma: il sistema Lattego √® davvero comodo, ma non riesce a produrre della schiuma davvero compatta.
Altro aspetto che non mi ha convinto √® comunque il grado di complessit√† dalla macchina: si parla di macchina automatica √® vero, ma forse delle istruzioni pi√π dettagliate per aiutare meglio l'utente nel settaggio sarebbe stato meglio.
Inoltre il ripiano porta tazzine in realt√† non scalda... √® in pratica soltanto un piano di appoggio.
Per ultimo, la macchina possiede il contenitore per il caff√® in grani, ma √® possibile fare caff√® anche con il caff√® gi√† macinato, inserendolo nell'apposito contenitore utilizzando l'apposito misurino fornito nella confezione. La possibilit√† di fare caff√® con due miscele differenti √® si comoda da una lato (per il caff√® macinato per esempio possiamo scegliere il decaffeinato) , ma cos√¨ facendo si pu√≤ erogare un solo caff√® per volta, perch√® non esiste un vero serbatoio separato per il caff√® macinato e per il prezzo e il livello del prodotto, mi sarei aspettato due serbatoi distinti e separati.

In definitiva una macchina molto completa, adatta a chi piace davvero il caff√® e a chi ne beve una gran quantit√†. Utile sia in famiglia (per i bambini in realt√† prepararsi una bevanda √® assolutamente facile e sicuro) sia in piccole realt√† come B&B.

Il vano per il caff√® gi√† macinato consiglio di lasciarlo aperto durante l'erogazione del caff√® per far fuoriuscire il vapore che altrimenti rimarrebbe intrappolato, creando umidit√† nella sommit√† del canale di caduta del caff√® macinato con rischio di creare muffe o odori e sapori poco piacevoli. Per questo motivo sconsiglio di usare e versarci caff√® gi√† macinato.

La bevanda va scelta dallo stupendo selettore touch sulla parte frontale che oltre ad essere molto scenico √® intuitivo da utilizzare: si tocca la bevanda desiderata e si apre il menu per regolare l'intensit√† e la lunghezza (o quantit√† nel caso del latte) di erogazione e il numero di tazze. Durante questa fase, se si utilizza un profilo, le impostazioni verranno salvate appena si avvia l'erogazione. I primi 3-4 caff√® sono da buttare, vengono fuori letteralmente acqua sporca.

A questo punto si apre un mondo.
Perch√© il caff√® di questa macchinetta, come tutte le automatiche, si discosta un po' dal classico espresso italiano, cortissimo, corposo, cremoso, nel senso che l'erogazione minima √® di 20ml, quando nei bar √® di 15 o anche meno, un fondo di tazza in pratica. Anche se la quantit√† √® pi√π generosa, la qualit√† si pu√≤ raggiungere con tanto impegno (e soprattutto tante prove) ottenendo un caff√® assai aromatico (ovviamente c'√® bisogno di chicchi adeguati), incredibilmente cremoso e leggermente corposo (detto francamente non lo sar√† mai come le macchinette a cialde o capsule - sempre a causa dell'erogazione generosa).
E se la primissima cosa da fare per ottenere questo risultato √® ridurre (gradualmente) la macinatura al minimo (compresa tra 1 e 3 a mio avviso), la seconda √® utilizzare il Ristretto come bevanda (si trova in Altro->Calde->Ristretto) perch√© √® l'unico che permette di scendere a 20ml. Questo specialmente se siete come me e il caff√® vi piace molto corto, perch√© selezionando Espresso e portandolo ai ml minimi √® comunque troppo lungo.
Dopodich√© bisogna alzare la temperatura di erogazione al massimo perch√© rispetto alle macchinette classiche i caff√® della Philips 5500 possono sembrare tiepidi: questa sensazione √® dovuta in parte alle nostre abitudini di bere caff√® al limite del bruciato, per√≤ questa temperatura permette di estrarre ogni molecola aromatica dai chicchi, rendendo il caff√® profumato e delicato. Il consiglio per mantenere il caff√® caldo pi√π a lungo √® quello di preriscaldare la tazza con dell'acqua bollente. Inoltre se fate due caff√® contemporaneamente, sconsiglio di mettere le tazze una accanto all'altra perch√© la doppia erogazione √® lenta (fa proprio il processo due volte) e i due caff√® saranno pi√π freddi del dovuto, meglio riempirne e servirne una per volta.

Corpo, crema, aroma, acidit√† dipendono dalla macinazione. Qui entrano in gioco i gusti personali, ognuno preferisce il caff√® in maniera diversa, marche di caff√® diverse richiedono impostazioni diverse e la Philips 5500 ci d√† grandi possibilit√† di sperimentazione, ma dopo ogni cambio di livello di macinatura bisogna fare almeno una decina di caff√® per apprezzarne le modifiche. E in generale bisogna farne tanti prima di poter apprezzare la potenza e le capacit√† di questa macchinetta. Una volta trovati i parametri giusti, sar√† un cannone e un piacere sorseggiare ogni singolo caff√®.

Il sistema LatteGO √® geniale perch√© il beccuccio del vapore non tocca mai il latte e lo schiuma attraverso un sistema a sifone. La schiuma √® soffice, areata, densa, corposa. Da non credere che un sistema totalmente automatico permetta di avere risultati del genere. Sembra una frase fatta ma il cappuccino √® davvero come al bar. Inoltre questo sistema permette una pulizia rapidissima sia automatica che manuale del contenitore del latte. Il beccuccio rimane sempre pulito.

Proprio per questi sistemi automatizzati di pulizia, l'acqua consumata da questa macchinetta √® davvero tanta, specialmente se si attiva la pulizia all'accensione (che tra l'altro fa uscire il primo caff√® un po' annacquato). 1 litro di acqua consumata in 2 giorni e circa 20-25 caff√®. Forse l'unico vero "prezzo" da pagare.
Il raccoglitore dell'acqua sotto la griglia e il contenitore dei residui di caff√® si smontano e puliscono anch'essi rapidamente e con estrema facilit√†: per il primo √® un'asticella rossa galleggiante a far capire quando √® il momento di svuotarlo, mentre per il secondo √® la macchinetta stessa a mandare un avviso.

Lo stesso vale per la manutenzione, sar√† la macchinetta a dire quando sar√† ora di effettuarla e tramite l'app della Philips √® possibile consultare le utilissime guide passo passo con foto e video (oltre che consigli generali per regolare la macchinetta o ricette da provare). Il gruppo di erogazione √® estraibile e va pulito in maniera particolare, ingrassato in punti specifici (il grasso √® fornito in confezione) e rimontato con cautela.

Insomma, una macchinetta fantastica per cui bisogna informarsi sulle basi del caff√®, come cambia al cambiare della macinatura e sperimentare tutto quello che si √® appreso, dandogli e dandosi del tempo. Alla fine ci si innamora.

title: This is an early review. Good coffee but a few potential niggles
body:
My "old" bean to cup coffee machine is now in its 6th year of use so I was very pleased to be able to order this new Philips model. I've only been using it for a week however so this is very much an early review that I'll update next month.

The machine arrives extremely well packed in a sturdy box, with lots of cardboard (much better than polystyrene) inside to keep all the parts well protected during transport. Assembling everything is reasonably straightforward, especially if you've used a similar coffee machine before. BUT (shouted because it's a major irritation as far as I'm concerned) the only instructions come in the form of a series of fairly small illustrations. Anyone new to this type of machine who doesn't have perfect eyesight might struggle to see clearly what to do.

By the time I set the machine up the actual proper manual, with words, was available online. In order to access it a QR code needs to be scanned and the manual downloaded but IMO it's a huge oversight on the part of Philips not to supply the manual in paper format. I know it's odd nowadays but I do actually read manuals and reading the one for this machine reveals that it's going to need a fair degree of cosseting in order to continue to give best performance. And anyone who hasn't read the words won't know how often to tend to various components, so won't have any comeback if something goes wrong and Philips blames user error.

Somehow I can't see it lasting as long as my previous machine, which has been well loved but not particularly well looked after. Yet it continues to work almost as well as it did when new.

My usual coffee is strong and black, with the occasional cappuccino that's always made with an extra shot. So far those are the only types of coffee we've tried from the machine and the results have been good. Everything is highly customisable when it comes to making any of the 20 different types of coffee available from this machine, so you can have as much liquid as desired, at the strength required, very quickly and easily.

I do like the fact that this machine holds more water than my previous one. However, the milk container doesn't hold a great deal and suffers from a drawback in that some milky froth remains on the spout after a drink has been made. If a user wanted to put the container plus remaining milk in the fridge after use, the spout would need very careful wiping - not ideal.

Having 4 user profiles is good since a profile makes it just a touch quicker to make a favourite type of coffee but 2 of the available profiles are already being used by me, for espresso lungo and cappuccino. I'll be the main user of the machine so that's not a problem but it could be significant in households with several avid coffee drinkers. That said, it's really not difficult to set up a favourite brew each time by pressing the buttons.

This machine is a bit more compact than my previous one and with the possibility of making iced coffees it certainly offers more options. I'm not yet sure whether it's quite as robustly made and I don't know yet how irritating I'm going to find it to do regular maintenance. It could be that the quality of the coffee produced by the machine, which so far seems to be very good, outweighs any perceived inconveniences. That's why I'll update this review next month and it's why I'll say recommended but with some reservations.

title: As good as coffee from the High Street chains.
body:
I love this Philips 5500 coffee machine, as a self-confessed caffeine fiend this has made my life so much easier as previously, I was grinding beans myself and faffing about with a portafilter etc, with this, it does it all for you.

It looks great, with its digital touch screen display, and comes with a big range of drinks options, the most common and well known being on the front, but it also has menus from which you can choose additional options. Extra froth? Sorted. Need a travel mug filled? Covers that too.

It can make ice drinks too, as well as being able to customise all the drinks to your preferred taste with extra shots or more milk/froth etc.

You fill the hopper on the top up with beans, or if you prefer it can also take ground coffee, fill with water and milk and away you go.

It comes with a water filter for the tank which you don‚Äôt have to use, but as we live in a hard water area it will definitely help to prolong the life of the machine and save me descaling all the time.

You can also set profiles for each family member, so you can customize your favourite drink, save it under your profile and the next time you come to use it just choose your profile and it will remember exactly how you like your drink made and make it the same way again without having to go through all the steps.

The coffee dispenser is height adjustable, so if it‚Äôs espresso you want you can move it down to dispense near the smaller cup, or up for longer drinks like lattes and cappuccinos.

Cleaning is easy, the main drip tray pulls out and the coffee grinds can be disposed of, and the drip tray rinsed out. A lot of it is also dishwasher friendly, with those parts stating as such on them, so it‚Äôs easy to keep clean.

The only thing to be aware of is when placing a cup under the dispenser is to make sure it‚Äôs sitting underneath both the coffee dispenser and the milk dispenser, or you‚Äôll end up with milk and no coffee or vice versa.

I love it, it makes drinks as well as high street coffee shops, I‚Äôve used it daily since it arrived and I'm looking forward to the warmer weather so I can indulge in iced lattes.

Das ist bereits unser dritter Kaffevollautomat - bisher der mit den meisten Kaffee-Optionen. Unsere vorherigen Kaffeevollautomaten waren sehr einfach gehalten, es gab Kaffee und Espresso zur Auswahl und das war es. Aber von Anfang an ‚Ä¶
Ich gehe jetzt nur auf besondere Punkte ein, eine genaue (Anwender-)Beschreibung w√§re zu umfangreich; es geht ja bei der Bewertung am meisten um den pers√∂nlichen Eindruck, den das Ger√§t auf einen macht.

Beim Aufstellen des Ger√§tes empfand ich tats√§chlich leichte Entt√§uschung, da f√ºr mich die ganzen Plastikteile (nur das Ablaufgitter ist aus Metall) leicht ‚Äöbillig‚Äò aussehen. Mein Vorg√§nger-Kaffeeautomat ist ein ganz einfaches Modell von Delonghi, das auch haupts√§chlich aus Kunststoffteilen besteht, das aber deutlich wertiger in der Optik und Haptik bei mir ankommt.
Es liegt eine Kurz-Anleitung (englisch) in Bildern bei, wie man die Maschine anschlie√üt und erste Einstellungen vornimmt (Sprache, Wasserh√§rte, Einsetzen Wasserfilter etc.).
Eine detaillierte Bedienungsanleitung in Papierform ist nicht beigef√ºgt, was ich als ein wirkliches Manko empfinde.
Man kann mittels QR-Code eine Bedienungsanleitung herunterladen, die mich wirklich viel Zeit zum Durcharbeiten gekostet hat. 29 Sprachen stehen zur Auswahl. Am Anfang der Anleitung ist der Kaffeevollautomat mit seinen Erkl√§rbildern (Tasten, Funktionen) abgebildet und die deutsche Anleitung kommt dann irgendwann auf Seite 60, wo immer wieder Bezug auf die Abbildungen der ersten Seite genommen wird. Ich kann an meinem Tablet nicht einfach zwischen den Seiten springen, sondern muss immer wieder ganz an den Anfang scrollen, um mir eine Abbildung anzuschauen und dann wieder auf Seite 60 ff, um den Text dazu zu lesen - wirklich entnervend (Beispiel: ‚ÄöDr√ºcken Sie die PUSH-Taste (Abb. 22) und ‚Ä¶‚Äò).

Was ich echt gut finde, sind die Profile, so kann jeder seine eigenen bevorzugten Einstellungen (Kaffest√§rke, Kaffemenge etc.) bei der entsprechenden Kaffeespezialit√§t speichern.
Tats√§chlich muss man da schon ein bisschen herumprobieren, bis man seine ideale Einstellung gefunden hat, wie einem eben der Kaffee, Capuccino etc. am besten schmeckt.

Die Vielfalt der Kaffeespezialit√§ten ist wirklich umfangreich. Es gibt hei√üe und kalte (Iced) Getr√§nkeauswahl, ich verwende aber bisher nur die hei√üen Getr√§nkem√∂glichkeiten. Die g√§ngigen Kaffespezialit√§ten sind direkt per Tastendruck anw√§hlbar, es gibt aber noch diverse weitere Optionen √ºber die Taste ‚Äöweitere Getr√§nke‚Äò (wie z.B. Caf√© Crema etc.).
Die Lautst√§rke ist im Vergleich zu meinem alten Kaffeevollautomaten deutlich leiser, das gef√§llt mir gut.

Mit ausschlaggebend f√ºr die Bestellung dieses Kaffeevollautomaten war f√ºr mich der LatteGo Beh√§lter. Dadurch, dass es hier keinen Milchschlauch gibt, habe ich einfach ein besseres Gef√ºhl in Bezug auf die Hygiene. Der LatteGo Beh√§lter kann in die Sp√ºlmaschine gegeben werden und das ist f√ºr mich eine echt saubere Sache.
Der Milchschaum selbst kommt allerdings nicht an den heran, den mein elektrischer, separater Milchschaumbereiter herstellt (den ich bei meinem alten Kaffeevollautomaten verwendet habe zur Herstellung eines Latte Macchiato etc.), ist aber okay.

Insgesamt bin ich zufrieden mit dem Philips Kaffeevollautomaten. Besonders positiv hervorzuheben sind die Kaffeespezialit√§ten-Vielfalt und die Profile.
Dringend nachzubessern w√§re m.E. mit einer detaillierten Bedienungsanleitung in Papierform (man muss ja doch immer mal wieder etwas nachlesen, z.B. bei der Reinigung etc.).

Die Auffang-Abdeckung.
Die Unterseite ist NICHT ENTGRATET! Wenn man da nicht aufpasst, schneidet man sich!
@Philips das m√ºsst ihr unbedingt nachbessern! Ihr seht ja auf der Anleitung, was ich mit ein wenig Hin-Her anrichten konnte.

Die Maschine selbst braucht dann, wenn sie zusammengebaut ist, meiner Meinung nach keine Anleitung.
Das ist alles sehr sprechend.
In den Einstellungen gibt es ein paar Settings wie Standby-Zeit, Temperatur, Ton ja/nein (nice!), Ma√üeinheit (ml, oz), Front-LEDs, sowas halt. Habe nichts vermisst.

Es gibt dann f√ºr die Kaffees erstmal... 4 verschiedene Profile! Nach Farben wie zB Gelb oder Gr√ºn.
Der Profil-Button links wird entsprechend dem gerade aktiven Profil eingef√§rbt.
Jedes Mal, wenn man einen Kaffee zieht, wird die aktuell verwendete Einstellung in das gerade aktive Profil gespeichert.
Sehr angenehme und vor allem schnelle Profil-Verwaltung, wenn man mich fragt!
Kenne das z.B. von einem anderen Hersteller (der so √§hnlich klingt wie die amerikanische Meile), wo man umst√§ndlich erst auf den Profil-Knopf muss, dann zum Profil navigieren muss, dann best√§tigen, dann kann man seine Sachen abrufen... aber eingestellt wird nochmal ganz anders... da ist das hier UM WELTEN besser gel√∂st!!

Bei jeder Kaffee-Variante kann man dann erst die Mahlmenge einstellen... wenig normal viel und "gib alles!".
Dann die Wassermenge.
Dann die Milchmenge.
Tastet euch einfach mal ran, was in welche Gef√§√üe bei euch passt.
Bitte bei normalen Gl√§sern aufpassen, die SPRINGEN ggfs. bei schneller Temperaturver√§nderung! Das nur als Info, falls es einer nicht wei√ü (dickere Gl√§ser sind anf√§lliger als d√ºnne).

Ins Fach oben passen vollkommen ausreichend viele Bohnen rein... manche hier schrieben das w√§re "klein", habe ich nicht verstanden.
Wenn ich mir 10 Kaffee ziehen kann, mit hoher Mahlmenge, dabei dann gerade mal 1/5? 1/6? weg ist... ok klar, f√ºr ein B√ºro kann das zu wenig sein, aber das ist halt auch keine B√ºro-Maschine...??
Will sagen: F√ºr zuhause ist das doch super. Selbst wenn mal viele G√§ste da sind und viel trinken - sch√ºttet man halt nach? Das passt also allemal.

Anbei dann noch ein Video von der Zubereitung eines Iced Latte.
Meine Empfehlung dazu: 8 - und zwar genau 8 - normgerechte Eisw√ºrfel auf eine normale Tassengr√∂√üe.
F√ºr den Effekt nutze ich dabei gerne eins meiner Cola-Gl√§ser, die F√ºllmenge ist da sehr √§hnlich (habe im Video Wassermenge und Milchmenge hochgedreht, nur als Referenz).
Dann geht sich das perfekt aus, man hat keine Eisw√ºrfel √ºber und die Temperatur ist *perfekt*.

Specials wie Milchschaum findet ihr unter "mehr Getr√§nke".
Mich hat das Men√º erst verwirrt - man muss dann erstmal ausw√§hlen ob es was Hei√ües oder Kaltes sein soll und *dann* geht es weiter. Milchschaum ist hei√ü ;)

Insgesamt bin ich bis auf die scharfkantige Abdeckung mehr als zufrieden.
Das ist auch der einzige Kritikpunkt, den ich an der kompletten Maschine habe.
Es ist alles mega wartungsfreundlich, sodass der Alltag mit dem Ger√§t (nutze es jetzt schon eine Woche) sowas von easy vonstatten geht... ein Traum!
Machste einmal in der Woche die Br√ºheinheit (im Sommer vllt. 2x, muss jeder selbst entscheiden) und sonst Leeren/F√ºllen nach Bedarf... that's it!? Wie angenehm ist das bitte? Gerade bei sowas wie Milch, was in Sekunden gereinigt ist und ansonsten keiner Pflege bedarf.

Somit gibt es von mir 5/5!!

title: Excellent kit, LOADS of options...
body:
Wonderful machine, still fine-tuning to my particular taste, but having fun doing it!.

After spending years of grinding, experimenting with various beans/combinations etc, it's great to simply hit a button and get a near-instant (compared to hand made anyway) lovely cup of coffee, and is an absolute delight to use.

The machine itself looks and feels very well made, which it should do for a premium bit of kit. This 'silent brew' version is supposed to be quieter than their previous model, but not having heard that one in operation I can't compare the two sound-wise. This one does still make a noise of course, but in comparison to what I've been doing all these years... grinding beans with the an electric hand grinder... it's positively SO much quieter, so more than likely the previous 'louder' model would still have been much better / easier on the ear.

The colour screen does make it look more professional, and basically this has been a real eye-opener on what's now achievable with these machines.

The water filter on the machine is great to have, and living in a hard-water area, filtering through jugs to fill the hot water dispensers (and basically for anything 'drinkable') is something we do with all our water, and although time consuming it's just second nature to do it all the time. On this machine, at least it's one less filter-jug-to-container job that needs to be done.

As said, I'm still getting to grips with the fine-tuning for a 'perfect' taste, but in all honesty it hasn't dispensed anything that isn't a great cup of coffee anyway. On that score, there's no wastage or disappointments at all.

Great stuff, absolutely love it, and can highly recommend it... especially anyone new to this 'brew-at-home' game.

On a quality/value-for-money basis... 5-Stars.

body: This Philips 5500 LatteGo coffee maker came packaged really nicely and protected well. Setup was fairly simple and the built in screen displays text whilst the touch capacitive glass allows you to select options. After selecting language you do need to select your water hardness and I'm guessing this helps calibrate the machine accordingly. Next you fill the tank with water. The tank is easy to remove and can hold a fairly large quantity of water in one go. It then slides right back in to the side easily. You can then install the AqauaClean filter to prevent limescale build up. The instructions easily guide you into how to do this. At this point, you can activate the filter which does take a few minutes. Now once done, you just load the top with your coffee beans and attatch the Milk jug on the side. It's nice that the machine will remind you to clean incase you forget but ideally once a week is enough or depending on how heavy it's used. There's a drip tray and ground container that can also be taken out easily and cleaned. There's a Clean option on the mker that you can use to quick rinse, Aqua Clean, Descale and for removal of Coffee Oil. Again, the machine guides you through how to do it and what steps to follow wich is ereally handy. You can also set profiles to save drink settings that will then remember for that profile which I thought was really handy for family members and saves time each time! An overall chunky sized machine but a very well thought out product from Philips that introduces a range of user friendly features and makes it super easy to use. Very impressed with the quality and highly recommend for coffee lovers.

title: Philips Series 5500 LatteGo
body:
Play Video
This product was sent to me to review, as part of Amazon Vine. Below is my own real-world experience of using it.

I normally use disposable pod-based coffee machines, and have no experience with a bean-to-cup model, so I was eager to try one out. My review will therefore come from a very novice angle.

Firstly, the instructions provided were a little vague, and I didn‚Äôt find the website to be much more helpful, since the information for this machine has not been published yet. It‚Äôs the same story if the accompanying app is downloaded. I eventually had the best experience by actually turning on the machine and following the setup process.

Putting everything together was fairly straightforward, though the milk container was somewhat fiddly - there is a clip on the bottom that can cause a water leak if not secured properly, I did not realise until mine started leaking during the machine‚Äôs first rinsing cycle. You also have to angle the container a certain way, to properly attach it. Furthermore, the main water tank is quite narrow, so it can be a challenge to get the hand in to fit the water filter.

In the box is a water hardness testing strip, that helps the device establish how often a descale would be required. You can input the test result, once gathered (my strip showed slight hardness, which seems accurate).

Navigating the menu is a breeze, thanks to the responsive and user-friendly interface - every option is laid out clearly, with shortcut buttons, and more in the ‚Äòmore drinks‚Äô section. The control panel is sensitive, so registers even the lightest touch of a button. It also has a backlight, helping to make the panel easier to read, no matter the time of day. If you change any of the default settings for a drink, that change is saved to the currently active profile (you can switch between three different ones).

I have tried out a few of the drinks available (cappuccino, latte macchiato), and have been happy with the results. There hasn‚Äôt been a ‚Äòperfect‚Äô one for me, yet, but I will get there, since there is so much customisation on offer - you can set your preferred water/milk level, temperature, and the fineness of the bean grind (again, as I am not experienced with beans, I don‚Äôt yet know how I like it). A particularly handy feature is the hot water dispenser, which comes through the side nozzle, rather than the same used for coffee blends - ideal for a quick cup of tea, etc.

When it comes to the ‚Äòsilent‚Äô claims of the machine, I feel that it‚Äôs anything but. A ‚Äòknocking‚Äô noise can be heard every time a coffee is made, whilst the entire process is very audible. It‚Äôs not too much of an issue, just unexpected.

Cleaning is straightforward - there are a number of settings available, depending on how much of a clean you‚Äôd like, or if a descale is needed. Some of the removable parts are dishwasher safe, too.

In summary, it is a high-quality, stylish machine for the coffee connoisseur, bringing cafe-style choice to the home. Highly recommended.

title: Quick and easy to make drinks
body:
There is no hanging around for long waiting for a coffee with this machine as it heats just the water needed for whichever particular drink is requested, not a whole tankful. Iced drinks can be made as well as hot drinks. There are lots of extra drinks available for Hot or Iced drinks if the 'More Drinks' button is pressed, eg Travel Mug, Milk Froth, Hot Water to name a few.

The machine has different user profiles (blue, green, red, guest, or yellow), which it uses to store your preferred settings for the drinks you choose, ie strength of coffee, amount of water, amount of milk, and temperature (low, medium, hot) etc. That's quite useful as I prefer my coffee stronger and hotter than my partner. The options are all touch screen and quite easy and intuitive to use.

It says it has a Quiet Brew feature, but that applies to the bean grinding, not the sound of the milk frother working, which can be quite loud. The fineness of the bean grind can be altered by pressing and turning the dial in the bean hopper at the top.

The machine can use either powdered coffee or grind beans itself. I used beans first, and then tried powered coffee next in the little hopper on the top. For some reason the machine dumped my unused 2 scoops of ground coffee into the used grounds hopper and cancelled the drink (no reason given on the display). I then noticed that the lid for the ground coffee has a faint picture of a scoop x 1 on it, so I then tried using only one scoop and it worked.

Most of the parts (not the brew group) are dishwasher friendly. There is a Clean button, which when pressed will give you 4 options: Quick rinse, AquaClean, Descaling, or Coffee oil removal. The machine comes with a litmus strip to test the water hardness in your area, which is used to set the life of the calcium water filter before it needs changing (the machine will let you know when this needs doing).
The machine self-rinses and it‚Äôs easy to clean the milk frother after making each drink, which means I get the best use out of it.

There is some regular maintenance required such as cleaning the brew group every week and lubricating it every 2 months. However, there are no instructions as to how to do this as the QR code in the booklet that comes with the machine doesn't work and the website doesn't seem to recognise the model EP5500 or EP5546/70. I have had to resort to looking online at similar Philips models for this information.

There is a HomeID app for this coffee machine (not connected to the appliance), which has is a troubleshooting guide and some coffee recipes for my machine. However, the 'Machine Set up guide' page is blank, as was the 'See all articles' page.

Overall, I feel Philips have really made an effort to make this machine quick and convenient to use with lots of different options. I am looking forward to trying some of the recipes on the app although the app and website could do with some work regarding lack of a user manual and maintenance instructions etc.

title: Philips Series 5500 LatteGo
body:
This product was sent to me to review, as part of Amazon Vine. Below is my own real-world experience of using it.

I normally use disposable pod-based coffee machines, and have no experience with a bean-to-cup model, so I was eager to try one out. My review will therefore come from a very novice angle.

Firstly, the instructions provided were a little vague, and I didn‚Äôt find the website to be much more helpful, since the information for this machine has not been published yet. It‚Äôs the same story if the accompanying app is downloaded. I eventually had the best experience by actually turning on the machine and following the setup process.

Putting everything together was fairly straightforward, though the milk container was somewhat fiddly - there is a clip on the bottom that can cause a water leak if not secured properly, I did not realise until mine started leaking during the machine‚Äôs first rinsing cycle. You also have to angle the container a certain way, to properly attach it. Furthermore, the main water tank is quite narrow, so it can be a challenge to get the hand in to fit the water filter.

In the box is a water hardness testing strip, that helps the device establish how often a descale would be required. You can input the test result, once gathered (my strip showed slight hardness, which seems accurate).

Navigating the menu is a breeze, thanks to the responsive and user-friendly interface - every option is laid out clearly, with shortcut buttons, and more in the ‚Äòmore drinks‚Äô section. The control panel is sensitive, so registers even the lightest touch of a button. It also has a backlight, helping to make the panel easier to read, no matter the time of day. If you change any of the default settings for a drink, that change is saved to the currently active profile (you can switch between three different ones).

I have tried out a few of the drinks available (cappuccino, latte macchiato), and have been happy with the results. There hasn‚Äôt been a ‚Äòperfect‚Äô one for me, yet, but I will get there, since there is so much customisation on offer - you can set your preferred water/milk level, temperature, and the fineness of the bean grind (again, as I am not experienced with beans, I don‚Äôt yet know how I like it). A particularly handy feature is the hot water dispenser, which comes through the side nozzle, rather than the same used for coffee blends - ideal for a quick cup of tea, etc.

When it comes to the ‚Äòsilent‚Äô claims of the machine, I feel that it‚Äôs anything but. A ‚Äòknocking‚Äô noise can be heard every time a coffee is made, whilst the entire process is very audible. It‚Äôs not too much of an issue, just unexpected.

Cleaning is straightforward - there are a number of settings available, depending on how much of a clean you‚Äôd like, or if a descale is needed. Some of the removable parts are dishwasher safe, too.

In summary, it is a high-quality, stylish machine for the coffee connoisseur, bringing cafe-style choice to the home. Highly recommended.

title: Step up your coffee game
body:
Very happy with this machine, it makes amazing coffees.

Having previously just used pre-ground coffees for at home and office drinks as well as , moving to using a machine was a bit of a daunting thought, but this was extremely easy to setup.

It comes nice and securely packaged, maybe a bit too secure as it took a while to get it fully unpackaged.. but once that was done, it was smooth sailing.

Simply hook it up to power, fill up the water tank (and install the filter if you have particularly hard water), add your coffee beans (or powder), some milk, and after running through setup, it's ready to go within 10 minutes.

The water tank is quite large, but not as large as others that I have seen - if you drink quite a lot of coffee or have family members that do, then you'll be refilling it up quite frequently. Very easy to do - no latches or any button presses; just pull out the tank from the front, and re-insert it once done. Easy.

It includes a water testing strip which you run under the tap for a few seconds, and then leave for a minute. Depending on the results of the strip, you may need to install the included anti limescale filter which you just push into the base of the water tank. I installed it before even running the tests just to ensure longevity of the machine.

You get a wide variety of coffees to make; espressos, cappuccinos, lattes, americanos, and even just hot milk - all of which can be selected by pressing one of the images on the console, or by scrolling through the options on the display (which is very responsive, no lag whatsoever). After selecting what you desire, you can fine tune the amount of coffee used, the amount of water, and the milk which can be saved as a preset for further use, saving time having to repeat it each time. As you can see from my pictures, I'm still figuring out the best parameters to fill up my mug! What's more, you can opt to just dispense hot water and/or hot milk so that you can make your own hot chocolate which my kids love.

Thanks to the LatteGo feature, the lattes & cappuccinos are especially frothy and taste amazing. The milk tank (which is where the magic happens) easily detaches for refilling and cleaning. There's even a handy meter on the side to tell you just how much you'll need for a particular type of coffee.

In regards to the "SilentBrew Technology", it's still relatively loud - it can be heard through our small house late at night, but it's a more subtle humming sound when heard from upstairs. It's certainly much more quiet than the De'Longhi machine in my office. Not that I regularly make coffees at silly hours, but there are times when I may need to leave the house at 5am for work.

The self-cleaning functions that it runs through on each shut down is a useful feature to reduce the hassle of maintaining it - it will dispense water and remnants of coffee once it has done into a cup, or into the easily-detachable spill tray.

Lastly, the size - it's nice and compact-ish, very slimline so that it can squeeze into a small kitchen - and it plays nicely with low overhead cupboards as the water tank and milk can be detached from the front. The coffee beans / powder has to be added to the top, but the lid easily comes off, rather than using hinges which would be a problem in height restricted areas.

For those like me who are not used to these fancy automated coffee making machines, they are extremely easy to set up and use - extremely convenient for those who want a coffee without the hassle of actually making it, or wanting to avoid the queue at Starbucks or Costa every morning! The instruction manual covers everything and is very easy to follow.

title: Amazing options and easy to clean
body:
Basic instructions are included with pictures to get you going. The main manual is via a QR code but this did not work when we tried it. A search on the Phillips website brought up the machine and its credentials but there were no instructions found for this product ‚Äì perhaps because it is so new?
So, we have plugged it in and used the panel which lights us to guide our way into making coffee over the past week. Here are a few pointers from a couple of basic coffee lovers who are not particularly techie:
‚Ä¢ The machine is easy to set up and get going. You plug it in, test your water using the litmus paper provided, set the water hardness, fit the water filter (just like your standard water filter jug this needs changing every few months) and fill with water. The jug contains enough for 6-8 cups.
‚Ä¢ The machine mainly relies on the use of coffee beans but of course you don‚Äôt need to have a separate grinder, it all does it for you. The compartment contains enough for many cups (20?).
‚Ä¢ There is a second, smaller compartment only takes enough for one drink at a time and this is for ground coffee. We are using normal strong beans in the main input and keep the other for when we want decaf and then it needs to be ground coffee.
‚Ä¢ One of the best things about this machine over others is the milk frother and dispenser. Unlike many machines the milk does not go through pipes and nozzles, it just heats and froths in a jug on the side front of the machine which then pours out the milk into the waiting cup. This does spit a bit and is noisy but it‚Äôs not too bad.
‚Ä¢ At this point I need to note one of the few negatives I have found in making coffees. In order for the milk AND coffee to be poured into a cup, the cup has to be places just in the right position under the machine. Too far back (which is the normal inclination to place the cup, the milk misses a bit. Too far forward, the coffee doesn‚Äôt make the cup.
‚Ä¢ The height of cup can be varied as the coffee nozzles move up or down to give the best flow for a small cup or a tall travel mug.
‚Ä¢ Now to using the panel of choices. There are so many. Not only can you make any of many coffee types eg latte, iced coffee, expresso etc but within each choice you can also choose amount of coffee used ie strength, amount of milk and water. It really is a matter of trying out what suits you. Thankfully, that has been considered and there are 4 profiles which you can set up with a person‚Äôs favourite combo for future use. Ther is also a guest profile which once a good combo is found, could be set so that your guests can have the best coffee.
‚Ä¢ Each coffee we have had has been delivered at a suitable temperature. Not really hot but neither is it cool. There is no real need to wait to warm up the machine, although I have read that that gives a hotter drink.
‚Ä¢ Cleaning is easy as the milk jug just gets washed up along with our cups. When you turn the machine off, it does a rinse automatically and if you forget to switch it off, it does so itself after a few minutes.
‚Ä¢ Once every few weeks it is recommended to remove the back and clean. We will do that each time we replace the beans.
‚Ä¢ The machine is a little noisy but we don‚Äôt mind that. Somehow it fits with the whole coffee making experience.
‚Ä¢ There is no coffee smell due to the sealed compartment for the beans. Sad in a way as I love the smell of coffee but probably best in the long term.
In conclusion:
PROS: Easy to use, very easy to clean, great coffee selection with options within options!
CONs: noisy, especially the milk issue and expensive

Overall, this is a great machine. A real treat to own and its even easier to clean than our last ¬£60 model, which had milk pipes which clogged up. We still haven‚Äôt tried all the settings to find a favourite but that‚Äôs the fun of owning such a complex bit of kit just to make a drink. My parents who still think instant coffee is a modern invention, think we‚Äôre mad!
